alert.note: Alert for Cody Foothills; North Big Horn Basin; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southwest Big Horn Basin; Wind River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 6:33PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorm outflow winds will impact portions of Hot Springs, east central Fremont, Big Horn, western Washakie and east central Park Counties through 715 PM MDT... At 631 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorm outflow winds along a line extending from 14 miles north of Cottonwood Pass to 11 miles south of Hamilton Dome. Movement was south at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. Wind gusts above 60 mph were recorded in the northern Bighorn Basin. SOURCE...Weather instrument indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Powell, Worland, Thermopolis, Lovell, Greybull, Basin, Shoshoni, Meeteetse, Byron, Lucerne, Ralston, Otto, Garland, Manderson, Kirby, Winchester, Hamilton Dome, Lost Cabin, Medicine Wheel, and Worland Municipal Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If on or near Boysen Reservoir, the Bighorn River, or the Wind River, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.

area.areaDesc: Cody Foothills; North Big Horn Basin; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southwest Big Horn Basin; Wind River Basin
